title: Ma Chak Shun
text:
Ma Chak Shun (born 2 March 1996) is a <a href="Women%27s%20association%20football">footballer</a> who plays as a <a href="defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a> for <a href="Hong%20Kong%20Women%20League">Hong Kong Women League</a> club Happy Valley AA. Born in Mainland China, she is also a <a href="futsal">futsal</a> player, and represented Hong Kong internationally in both <a href="Hong%20Kong%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">football</a> and <a href="Hong%20Kong%20women%27s%20national%20futsal%20team">futsal</a>.
International career.
Ma Chak Shun has been capped for Hong Kong at senior level in both <a href="Association%20football">football</a> and <a href="futsal">futsal</a>. In football, she represented <a href="Hong%20Kong%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Hong Kong</a> at two <a href="AFC%20U-19%20Women%27s%20Championship">AFC U-19 Women's Championship</a> editions (<a href="2013%20AFC%20U-19%20Women%27s%20Championship">2013</a> and <a href="2015%20AFC%20U-19%20Women%27s%20Championship">2015</a>), two <a href="EAFF%20E-1%20Football%20Championship%20%28women%29">EAFF E-1 Football Championship</a> editions (<a href="2017%20EAFF%20E-1%20Football%20Championship%20%28women%29">2017</a> and <a href="2019%20EAFF%20E-1%20Football%20Championship%20%28women%29">2019</a>), the <a href="2018%20AFC%20Women%27s%20Asian%20Cup%20qualification">2018 AFC Women's Asian Cup qualification</a>, the <a href="Football%20at%20the%202018%20Asian%20Games%20%E2%80%93%20Women%27s%20tournament">2018 Asian Games</a> and the <a href="2020%20AFC%20Women%27s%20Olympic%20Qualifying%20Tournament">2020 AFC Women's Olympic Qualifying Tournament</a>.
In futsal, Ma Chak Shun played for <a href="Hong%20Kong%20women%27s%20national%20futsal%20team">Hong Kong</a> at the <a href="2015%20AFC%20Women%27s%20Futsal%20Championship">2015 AFC Women's Futsal Championship</a>.
